title: Script Typeface?
content:
Hi, Does anyone know the fonts being used in the attached images?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Glo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/typophile.com/files/Glo.png) | 13.89 KB |
| [Knit.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/typophile.com/files/Knit.png) | 16.2 KB |
author: DC80924

comments.content:
The Knit one is Kestrel by Alan Meeks.  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/alanmeeks/kestrel/script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/www.fonts.com/font/alanmeeks/kestrel/script "http://www.fonts.com/font/alanmeeks/kestrel/script")

Glo: close to [Billabong](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeassociates/billabong), [Brannboll](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/brannboll) (almost matching)  
Knit: seconded. [Kestrel](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/foundry/alan_meeks/K/)/ [Falkner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/falkner-pro/)/ [Ballpark Weiner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016103633/http:/www.dafont.com/ballpark-weiner.font)
And Ballpark Weiner being a cheap copy of Kestrel...
